emails.subject: Re: Strange values in Average in Russia snow and soil temperature dashboard
emails.to: Martin Keller; Pablo Figueroa; Support Dnext
emails.body_text:
All good now 
________________________________

De : Jebrane Ben Salem <jebrane.bensalem@dnext.io>
Envoyé : Wednesday, January 14, 2026 6:38:01 PM
À : Martin Keller <martin.keller@dnext.io>; Pablo Figueroa <pablo.figueroa@dnext.io>; Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>
Objet : Re: Strange values in Average in Russia snow and soil temperature dashboard 
 
Hello again, 


The issue is fixed now! Just we still have 3 missing days for the year 2025(21-23Feb) and @Martin Keller <mailto:martin.keller@dnext.io>  is fixing it.
I'll refresh the dashboard again just after

________________________________

From: Martin Keller <martin.keller@dnext.io>
Sent: 14 January 2026 14:05
To: Jebrane Ben Salem <jebrane.bensalem@dnext.io>; Pablo Figueroa <pablo.figueroa@dnext.io>; Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>
Subject: Re: Strange values in Average in Russia snow and soil temperature dashboard 
 
Running a fix now for Snowflake. Probably worth mentioning here that we have uniqueness constraints in the new Postgres instance to avoid precisely this scenario...
________________________________

From: Jebrane Ben Salem <jebrane.bensalem@dnext.io>
Sent: 14 January 2026 12:58
To: Martin Keller <martin.keller@dnext.io>; Pablo Figueroa <pablo.figueroa@dnext.io>; Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>
Subject: Re: Strange values in Average in Russia snow and soil temperature dashboard 
 
Hello Martin, 

The Issue is not in the Power BI calculation because we're using the same in all the dashboards even for SM and NDVI.
I just checked the data; I find that we have 1 Value for all the years (2000-202) for the 24-Feb for the region where GID= 921.
But for 2025 we have  321 Value for the same date and Same GID, can you check it please.





________________________________

From: Martin Keller <martin.keller@dnext.io>
Sent: 14 January 2026 08:46
To: Pablo Figueroa <pablo.figueroa@dnext.io>; Jebrane Ben Salem <jebrane.bensalem@dnext.io>; Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>
Subject: Re: Strange values in Average in Russia snow and soil temperature dashboard 
 
Averages are currently computed in PowerBI
________________________________

To: Jebrane Ben Salem <jebrane.bensalem@dnext.io>; Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>; Martin Keller <martin.keller@dnext.io>
Subject: Re: Strange values in Average in Russia snow and soil temperature dashboard 
 
It's the average line so most likely a power bi issue?


________________________________
